intro: Ononis natrix subsp. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands or along paths. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed or marginal environments.
